meanings.sent1: I had to drag my heavy suitcase through the airport.
meanings.sent2: The worker had to drag the cart filled with boxes across the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The puppy thought it was fun to drag its leash behind it like a tail.
meanings.sent4: Her tired feet felt like they had to drag through the thick mud of exhaustion.
meanings.sent5: The old man had to drag his tired body up the steep hill.

meanings.sent1: The snail's drag across the sidewalk was barely noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The heavy load made the journey a drag for the hiker.
meanings.sent3: The sloth's idea of a race would be a drag for sure.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass in a drag as they waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The slow drag of the hours made the school day feel endless.

meanings.definition: A costume worn by a performer.
meanings.sent1: The actor put on his drag for the play.
meanings.sent2: The drag for the masquerade ball was elaborate and colorful.
meanings.sent3: The drag for the Halloween party was a hit with everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her drag for the dance recital sparkled under the stage lights.
meanings.sent5: The drag for the circus performance was designed to dazzle the audience.

meanings.definition: Resistance to motion through a fluid.
meanings.sent1: The swimmer felt the drag of the water as she pushed through the pool.
meanings.sent2: The drag of the heavy fabric slowed down the swimmer's lap time.
meanings.sent3: The boat's speed was affected by the drag of the anchor in the water.
meanings.sent4: The drag of the wind against the sailboat made sailing more challenging.
meanings.sent5: The drag of the river current made it difficult for the kayaker to paddle upstream.

meanings.sent1: The drag at the racetrack attracted many car enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: The drag was a thrilling event with roaring engines and fast cars.
meanings.sent3: The drag brought together competitors from all over the country.
meanings.sent4: The drag showcased the speed and power of different vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The drag was a high-energy competition that kept the crowd on their feet.
